div.div: ATTENTION PARENTS AND GUARDIANS! At this time Governor J. B. Pritzker has stated that all public schools will remain closed through the rest of the school year. Therefore, Remote/E-Learning will resume Monday, April 20th through the end of the school year. Academic Packet information has been mailed and is also available right here on our website on each school’s web-page. Please, don’t forget to complete the Parent Feedback Survey for Technology Assessment, which is located here, on the website front-page. The Grab and Go Curbside Breakfast and Lunch program will remain in effect Monday-Friday from 8:00 am-11:00 am at the Middle School located at 1650 Pulaski Road in Calumet City, IL. Another Resource: The Thornton Township Food Pantry located at 15340 Page Avenue in Harvey, Illinois is available on Wednesdays from 10:00 am until 5:00 pm to assist families in need. Stay well and safe!

div.em: Current conditions as of 24 Apr 07:15 am CDT

div.span: Isolated showers before 1pm, then isolated showers after 4pm. Patchy fog before 9am. Otherwise, cloudy, with a high near 49. North wind 5 to 10 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

Showers likely before 1am, then periods of rain, mainly after 1am. Low around 43. North northeast wind around 10 mph, with gusts as high as 15 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New precipitation amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.
Periods of rain. High near 48. Northeast wind 10 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New precipitation amounts between three quarters and one inch possible.

h2.a: Berger Vandenberg Elementary School's Distance Learning and Community Reach Video Messages

h1.span:
Video Message by Dr. Tiffany Graham, School Psychologist-
Make the MOST of Each Moment

div.p:
Dear Parents and Guardians:
Suspension of In-person Instruction for the Remainder of the 2019-2020 School Year
I hope this message finds you and your families safe and well. On April 17th, Illinois Gov. JB Pritzker announced that remote learning in Illinois will be extended through the end of the 2019-2020 school year. Our district 149 family is saddened by the reality that our school community will not be able to reconvene in person this school year due to this public health crisis. Although in-person learning has been suspended for the remainder of the school year, I assure you our entire staff remains committed to learning and engaging with all students and continuing our breakfast and lunch program. . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Superintendent's Corner

div.p:
Dear Dolton School District 149 Family,
On behalf of the Board of Education, I want to personally acknowledge each parent for your patience, dedication, and understanding. This COVID19 pandemic has been a devastating time for our school district community and families. We miss our children dearly and hope we will get through this storm, so that everyone can be together again soon.
Our mission as a Board and school district is to educate the whole child which provides a nurturing, safe and orderly learning environment, where children can grow and learn to become successful members of the community. I know forms of communication may sometimes sound repetitive. Please understand that student learning is one of . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Board President's Message

h1.a: Parent Feedback Survey for Technology Assessment

div.div: Dear Parents and Guardians. We’d like to learn more about you and your child’s internet and device experiences at your home. This information will help us to plan and prepare for a future e-learning initiative. Please complete this survey and click "Done" when you are finished. Your participation in this survey is greatly appreciated!
